H0.text: The moon and Earth are the representations that a model must include to best demonstrate the cause of the phases of the moon, as investigated by science students.

H1.text: The moon and the sun are the representations that a model should include to best demonstrate the cause of the phases of the moon, which science students investigated.

H2.text: The moon, the sun, and Earth are the representations that would best demonstrate the cause of the phases of the moon in the model investigated by science students.

H3.text: The moon, the sun, and Venus are the representations that the model should include to best demonstrate the cause of the phases of the moon, as investigated by science students.

A4.text: The phases of the Moon are caused by the angle of the Sun in relation to the Moon.

A5.text: The phases of the Moon are not caused by the Earth's shadow falling on the Moon.
